extendedInfo.description: Flow is an on-screen keyboard that enables exceptionally fast text input on your phone. It combines many different features to improve typing speed:- Enter each word in a single gesture (similar to Swype or SlideIT). Touch the first letter, move your finger smoothly from one key to the next, and lift it when you reach the end of the word. Spaces between words are inserted automatically.- The keyboard layout is optimized by analyzing common patterns in English words. The QWERTY layout used by most keyboards was designed for typing with two hands, and it's a terrible layout for on-screen use. The Flow layout is optimized so common words can be entered with the shortest, smoothest path possible.- Keys are large and evenly spaced for improved accuracy.- The most common punctuation symbols are directly available without needing a modifier key.- Double letters are recognized automatically. You don't need to "scribble over" them like with Swype.- When a word is recognized, it flashes briefly on top of the keyboard. You don't need to move your eyes away from the keyboard to verify it.- Long-press any key for a selection of alternate characters.- Supports voice input.- Supports both American and British English.Try Flow today and start improving your typing speed - guaranteed, or your money back! (How many other free keyboards dare to promise THAT?) And please send feedback so we can continue to improve Flow. Suggestions and bug reports are always welcome. Flow is an open source project.

reviews.title: Symbols please!
reviews.comment: Everything is fine, except the fact that there are very few symbols available. Fix that and then I can give you 5 stars :) Reply: Yes I do know that, but even then, there are a few symbols missing, such as: \342\210\232 \317\200 \302\243 \302\242 \342\202\254 \302\260 ^ \342\204\242 \302\256 \302\266 \302\251. All these symbols are easily available on the stock keyboard though. So if you could fix that, i\'d be happy :)
reviews.author: Abhijn Chadalawada

reviews.title: The best keyboard-sometimes
reviews.comment: This keyboard is really innovative, but lately it has been behaving strangely. Whenever I try to type something, the letter or word automatically deletes itself, rendering this wonderful app unusable. Typing this with TouchPal Keyboard (another goodie), but I\'d rather be using Flow... Any tips on how to fix this would be great (HTC One V).
reviews.author: Gabe McG

reviews.title: Great Innovation
reviews.comment: Finally something getting away from Qwerty which really makes sense. Took a few days to learn, and a few weeks to get comfortable with.  Dedication from the developer has given some really great updates.
reviews.author: Anthony Hugh

reviews.title: Good in theory but not practice
reviews.comment: I gave this a full week. I was starting to learn placement of letters. Lack of basic contractions (don\'t, for example) and, as far as I could see, the app\'s inability to learn my words led me to abandon.
reviews.author: Kristi Borst

reviews.title: Going with the flow
reviews.comment: I\'ve never really gotten on with other gesture type keyboards. You type the word test and instead get the word treat! This keyboard is a lot better but not quite perfect due to the unique layout.   The only improvement I would like to see is how you deal with corrections. I tend to type the whole paragraph out and then correct any mistakes. When you move the cursor to incorrect word other keyboards will offer the words that you where likely going for. Flow does not do this
reviews.author: Harvey Bernstein

reviews.title: Remarkably useful!
reviews.comment: The Flow app has made it possible for me to write long posts on my Samsung Galaxy Nexus almost as easily as I can on my desktop\'s keyboard. It\'s amazing that this outstanding program is free while similar apps aren\'t - and annoying that those other apps are effectively making Flow invisible in the Google Play store.  I\'ve compared it to the built-in swiping keyboard of Android 4.2.2, and Flow is definitely much faster and better. And it\'s free. It doesn\'t even have ads. How can you beat that?
reviews.author: Peter Maranci

reviews.title: good keyboard
reviews.comment: I would like to use this keyboard more as it is well thought out and designed. Too many times I have to erase a word and re-type it out as the accuracy/prediction of sliding is a little tighter then other keyboards I\'ve used.
reviews.author: Todd Lambert

reviews.title: Need customization
reviews.comment: This is a great keyboard! Very clever layout of the keys. I\'m not typing as fast as Swype yet, but not a fair comparison since I\'ve been using qwerty for years.  please give us the option to customize the keyboard!  1. colour and shape of the keys 2. font size of the prediction - it\'s VERY big right now 3. size of the keyboard 4. separate options for auto-cap and auto-space
reviews.author: Yuen King Ho

reviews.title: At last
reviews.comment: I\'ve been looking for a good fast alternative to the standard cramped querty keyboard in portrait mode. I\'d been relatively happy with the T9 style keyboards but this is definitely an improvement. It may take a little time to get used to it - a couple of days perhaps - but the investment is well worth it. The layout of the keys is intuitive and very fast for the most common word combinations. I hope that more people give it the chance that it deserves. I\'m very happy with it.
reviews.author: Michael Johnson

reviews.title: Almost perfect
reviews.comment: This idea is great, the only thing it needs is options to change the colors. Really bad color scheme. I\'ll even help you make the change of keys if you want
reviews.author: Gage Peterson

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.comment: This is a very good keyboard even though I can\'t get the \"flow\" action to work.  I LOVE the letter placement!  I agree that access to cursor arrows would make this even better.(maybe on a third alternative keyboard)
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Me
reviews.comment: Great concept, innovative, simple, quick... but it definitely and totally NEEDS WORD PREDICTION function. Do this, and I\'ll reinstall.
reviews.author: Eric Woods

reviews.title: I love it!
reviews.comment: Takes some getting used, of course, but it\'s near perfect. Needs a couple small things, like a faster delete, but it\'s fun smart and unique... for now.
reviews.author: James Strawn

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment: This is so fast as soon as you get used to it. A full size version for the PC would be nice, but you can\'t have everything.  Minor niggle is the lack of autospace after a word has been touched, and integration with the main dictionary would also be on the wish list.  Overall an excellent and well thought out product that drags the keyboard from it\'s typewriter roots into the 21st century.
reviews.author: Dave Alexander

reviews.title: Struggle with underscores
reviews.comment: Trailed this for a few weeks now and its dissapointing because I really wanted it to be good. I found the \'long press\' feature too difficult to understand.. I don\'t know why its so unreliable but half the time I try to access special characters it simply doesn\'t work. It also blocks my view of goggle chrome when Im typing in the web address bar so I struggle to see what I\'ve typed sometimes. \' __dddd_d___ddd_ddd_ddd__dd___ddd\'  thats me trying to write a continuous line of underscores... Not great
reviews.author: Tom Duckworth

reviews.title: Flow
reviews.comment: Too bad they tired to reinvent the wheel.  Nice looking; good flow , but not making  it qwerty, made it counter-intuitive.
reviews.author: Edward James

reviews.title: Very good
reviews.comment: But it needs languages, like Romanian for instance...
reviews.author: florin flueras

reviews.title: Good idea but has flaws
reviews.comment: The concept is brilliant but it always crashes. 6/10 times ill get \"unfortunately, flow has stopped\"
reviews.author: Brandon Rhodes

reviews.title: Very Good
reviews.comment: I\'m really liking it. My only complaint is that it has trouble with common contractions, which I seem to have no choice but to enter manually, one character at a time. For example, I \"can\'t\" and \"l\'ll\". Also, there\'s no way to exit the keyboard.
reviews.author: Lee Raulin

reviews.title: Good but ...
reviews.comment: Can be quite slow when its predicting when using the slide feature.
reviews.author: A Google User
